main event: An unidentified flying object sighting occurred on March 16, 1963, in Opa-Locka, Florida.
interesting points: The sighting involved two objects that were stationary at an altitude of 1000-2000 feet., The objects were described as bigger and brighter than stars or planets., The lights were orange, whitish, or reddish-orange and widely spaced apart., The observer concluded it was a definite unidentified flying object, possibly a balloon or aircraft., There was a follow-up by Air Force personnel, indicating some interest in the sighting.
witness description: The witness described the objects as brighter than stars and capable of changing pace and position, noting they were not planes or known craft.
